channel.title: Freedom|Lincoln County|Wyoming|United States on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Freedom|Lincoln County|Wyoming|United States on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: WY-239 West - Entering Freedom
item.description: Entering Freedom on WY-239 west - Elevation 5900; Population 214. Freedom is the oldest community in the Star Valley, and is named because of the settlers who were free to practice polygamy in Wyoming. The western boundary of the town is the Idaho stateline, where at the time had banned polygamy.

item.title: US-89 North at WY-239
item.description: US-89 north at WY-239 west to Freedom and Soda Springs (Idaho). WY-239 connects with ID-34 at the state line, via Stateline Road.

item.title: Stateline Road North at ID-34
item.description: Stateline Road north at ID-34 south to Wayan and Soda Springs. The right side of the road is in Wyoming, the left side in Idaho.

item.title: WY-239 East - Freedom
item.description: WY-239 east in Freedom. This is the only indication that the road crossed into Wyoming.
